name: Guest access
desc: As a guest, I should be able to see a list of all teams and their members, because I might be interested in observing the event.

name: Team management
desc:
As a participant, I should be able to manage a team, so that I can be with my preferred team mates.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Invite system
- Team attributes

name: Simple CMS
desc: As an admin, I should have basic CMS tools, so that I can manage various static pages.

name: Money management
desc: As an admin, I should be able to overview and manage sponsorships and expenses for the event, so that I can plan ahead better and be accountable.

name: Statistics
desc: As an admin, I should be able to view statistics about the event, so that I can measure how the organisation is performing.

name: Attendance checking
desc: As an admin, I should be able to check participants in each day, so that I can gather attendance statistics.

name: Freebies tagging
desc: As an admin, I should be able to tag participants as having received a freebie (food, sponsor prizes, etc.), so that they are fairly distributed.

name: Continuous integration
desc: CI should be added to the repository.

name: Mentor registration
desc: As a guest, I should be able to register as a mentor, because I might be interested in helping.

name: Mentor acceptance
desc:
As an admin, I should be able to review mentor requests and accept them, because there should be official mentors.

- The other administrators should be notified of the acceptance.

name: Export statistics to Excel/CSV
desc: As an admin, I should be able to export the finance statistics, the participants and their teams to an Excel or CSV document, because further editing or calculations might be required.

name: Decent look and feel
desc:
As a guest, I should be able to enjoy the site both on mobile and the web, because we live in 21st century.

- Perhaps buy a cheap boostrap theme and use it

name: Integrate the mail into the admin panel
desc: As an admin, I should be able to see all mails sent to team@hacktues.com and eventually reply to them, because it'll be easier and it'll be shared with the other administrators.

name: Event problems administration
desc:
As an admin, I should be able to see all enties submitted to the event problems page, because I might want to troubleshoot them.

- All other administrators should be notified.

name: Event problems page
desc: As a participant, I should be able to report a problem I'm experiencing, so that admins can resolve it.

name: Repository/archive submission
desc: As a participant, I should be able to submit my work, because I have finished it before the desired deadline.

name: Submission review
desc:
As an admin, I should be able to see the repository/archive submissions and accept or decline them, because some of them might be after the deadline or stolen.

- Perhaps run through a plagiarism tool of any sort. (Automated?)

name: Mentor selection
desc:
As a participant and leader of the team, I should be able to choose a mentor for it from the page with the mentors, because the mentor I decide to choose might be good at the technology I'm using.

- The mentor should receive a notification, should be asked to accept the invitation and the team mentor should be set to him if the invitation is accepted
- All administrators should receive a notification once a mentor is selected for a team.

name: Admin notifications
desc: As an admin, I should be able to see a notification for EVERY possible action, including, but not limited to: sponsorship mails, finance management, participant deletions, participants check etc., because I should be aware of everything.

name: Technology addition
desc: As an admin, I should be able to add a certain technology, because there should be a predefined set of technologies.

name: API
desc: As I guest, I should be able to consume a set of predefined API endpoints, because I might be interested in retrieving data about the event in my application.

name: Deployment procedure
desc: A deployment procedure should be specified, so that new updates can be efforlessly pushed into production.

name: Participant registration
desc:
As a participant, I should be able to register for an event, so that I can access member features.

**Acceptance criteria:**
- User authentication
- Profile page
- Profile editing

name: Password hashing
desc: Passwords should be stored in a secure manner, so that no privacy breaching is possible.

name: TLS
desc: All traffic going through the application should be encrypted and a Let's Encrypt certificate should be used.

name: Email confirmation
desc: As a participant, I should receive email confirmation upon registration, so that spam can be prevented.
